[<'The Taproot upgrade is a "soft fork" which means it is an optional feature. You don\'t have to use it or change anything in your use of Bitcoin because of it. But many wallets are likely to implement it for cheaper fees and better privacy'>]

[<'Taproot will increase Bitcoin privacy by making complex scripts (e.g. Lightning channel closure) indistinguishable from simple payments. Schnorr Signatures optimize transaction signing and open the door for many other features and optimizations'>]

[<'Today the Taproot feature set (Taproot, Tapscript, Schnorr Signatures) locked in on the Bitcoin mainnet. It will be activated for use on November 2021. Wallet and infrastructure implementations have 5 months to code and test their use of Taproot if they want to provide to clients'>]
[<'RT @gladstein: 1/ Bitcoin is a powerful tool for human rights.\n\nWhat is happening in El Salvador will have a huge impact on the lives of pe…'>]
[<'Here\'s our "Speaking of Bitcoin" podcast episode where we discussed this:\n\nhttps://t.co/0Ny5rvvQr2'>]

[<'Taproot will be locked-in for a November activation in the next 36 hours. 

A big success for #Bitcoin, Taproot introduces a second signature algo (Schnorr) and significant privacy features.

Also a big success for the "Speedy Trial" activation method with < 8 weeks to lock-in.'>]

[<'@chain_doctor You\'re missing the point by a mile. \n\nA token that represents the "deed" to my car and also is the means by which I start the car (the key), is not money but it is very useful. Not everything needs to be money. You can do NFTs on Bitcoin if you want.'>]
[<"@fortalacer Colored coins, since 2013. They weren't very successful in the context of Bitcoin">]
[<'@DontTraceMeBruh Bitcoin is fungibl-ish'>]

[<'@JallyWhiskey @RevPriest @Mario_Gibney @allenf32 Defining "intrinsic" as a floor-value can easily be applied to Bitcoin or other digital currencies:

Bitcoin is an access token that allows you to write messages on a global bulletin board in indelible ink. 

That function doesn't go away regardless of its monetary value.'>]
[<'@BreakingFrancis Bitcoin private keys only use 128 bits of entropy effectively, so mnemonics with more than 12 words are falling out of favor as they are cumbersome without adding security.'>]

[<"@watchthedigit a) I've demonstrated my intellectual integrity for years, so this is a baseless accusation

b) Bitcoin can easily introduce new signature schemes (including Q-resistant) in the protocol with a soft-fork

c) Taproot/Schnorr upgrade in 2021 will demo upgradeability of sig schemes.">]
[<'This video Q&A on #quantumcomputing & #Bitcoin has been trending recently. Learn about why it’s not a threat to Bitcoin in less than 10min: https://t.co/I6SvyAmYs4 https://t.co/HrcbxhsLkM'>]

[<'@br4s1d4s @wintermutegr @jojo4joseph1 @jackdanger Bitcoin is expected to introduce Schnorr signatures this year. Unlike a transition to a different consensus algorithm, this type of change is opt-in, backwards/forwards compatible and a soft-fork not a hard-fork. We can do it for as many signature algos as needed.'>]
